III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry.
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
Description and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation The worker is sharing personal or confidential information about
the child's birth mother with the foster parent.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant
On 10/1/2024, I interviewed Complainant by telephone.
Complainant reported being concerned that Department of Health
and Human Service (DHHS) Worker is giving Foster Parent
information about Child A’s (age 3) and Child B’s (age 2) birth
mother. Complainant said, Foster Parent, told her things about the
birth mother’s living situation and she nor the birth mother
informed Foster Parent of that information. Complainant said
Foster Parent is always asking her questions about the birth
mother and she either ignores Foster Parent or directs Foster
Parent to the agency. Complainant reported Foster Parent told her
she and DHHS Worker talk all the time. That DHHS Worker told
her birth mother can’t get into an abuse center or shelter.
Complainant reported there was also a time that the birth mother
was in the hospital and Foster Parent asked her why, then stated,
“I already know, DHHS Worker told me”. Complainant was unable
to speak to why Foster Parent would tell her that information or
why DHHS Worker would share such information. Complainant
reported not knowing if DHHS Worker and Foster Parent are
friends but thought they might be friends on Facebook.
Complainant was not aware of DHHS Worker sharing specific
confidential information to Foster Parent, giving Foster Parent the
birth mother’s address, social security information or other
identifiable type of confidential information. She reported just
being concerned that Foster Parent is asking her so many
questions that she just wants someone to talk with Foster Parent
and ask Foster Parent to stop asking her information. She said
she has reported this concern to her supervisor in the past.
Chief Administrator (CA)
On 10/2/2024 I spoke with CA about this allegation by telephone.
CA reported not being aware of such allegations pertaining to
DHHS Worker. CA reported with respect to Child A’s and Child B’s
2

case there was a matter they had to address related to a situation
with the child placing agency’s (CPA) contractual person. That
person was sharing information about the case to the foster parent
and so, they referred the matter to that agency to address it.
CA reported DHHS Worker has been with Arenac DHHS for about
a year, and there have been no concerns or professional issues
reported related to DHHS Worker’s work or her interactions with
others. She said DHHS Worker came to them from a private
agency, and that agency did not report any professional concerns
or inappropriate behaviors for DHHS Worker. She said DHHS
Worker had not reached out to her with concerns that the
children’s foster parent has been trying to get too much
information on the children’s birth mother. Nor has DHHS Worker
requested guidance on how to handle such a matter. CA said
DHHS Worker’s supervisor would be more abreast of something
like that.
Foster Parent
On 10/4/2024 I interviewed Foster Parent by telephone. Foster
Parent reported DHHS Worker updates her on her foster
children’s case by way of family team meetings or reporting at
court hearings. She reported that most of the information she gets
on the case comes from Person X, who provides transportation for
Child A and Child B’s and has been involved in their case since
6/13/2024. She said DHHS Worker will tell her information she
needs to know, such as when parenting times are, when they get
cancelled, and FTM and court hearing dates. She denied DHHS
Worker sharing confidential or personal information about the birth
mother with her. She denied she and DHHS Worker having a
relationship other than worker and caregiver. She reported that
Person X tells her many things, such as where the birth mother
lives, works and that birth mother missed a drug test. Additionally,
Person X has stated in the past that if the children should come up
for adoption she has lots of people who would want to adopt. As
recent as today, Person X told her if birth mother continues to do
good, birth mother will get unsupervised visits. Foster Parent said
DHHS Worker had yet to informed her of that information. She
was not sure whether Person X was supposed to have shared that
information with her. She said Person X never told her whether it
was okay or not okay for Person X to tell her the things Person X
reported about the birth mother. Foster Parent denied asking
Person X for any of the information. She also reported knowing
that Person X was telling the birth mother information about her.
That Person X told the birth mother she only lives four to five
minutes from the birth mother.
3

Department of Health & Human Service (DHHS) Supervisor
On 10/4/2024 I interviewed DHHS Supervisor by telephone. She
reported no knowledge of such an allegation pertaining to DHHS
Worker. Nor did she believe the allegation to be creditable. She
reported there being no actions or behavior by DHHS Worker that
would cause her to think DHHS Worker would share confidential
information about Child A and Child B’s birth parent or any birth
parent. She said DHHS Worker is not a new worker to the field.
DHHS Worker has been professional in her work and has had no
disciplinary actions. Nor had it ever been reported to her that
DHHS Worker and Foster Parent were friends, personally or on
Facebook.
DHHS Supervisor affirmed information as reported by the CA
related to there being a person with a contracted agency who was
sharing information with the foster parent. She reported this
person, whom she named as Person X, was also sharing
information with the birth mother on the foster mother. She said
that issue came up a while ago and they addressed it with the
agency. She said she and DHHS Worker meet often, and DHHS
Worker has never reported that Person X had shared a concern
with her that Foster Parent was asking questions or trying to get
information from her on the birth parent. She reported if that had
been the case, DHHS Worker would have told her. She confirmed
information reported by Foster Parent about Person X sharing with
the birth mother that birth mother and Foster Parent only live four
to five minutes away from each other. DHHS Supervisor further
reported that there have been other issues with Person X, and
perhaps I should speak with the Community Resource
Coordinator who facilitates contract transportation services with
the agency.
Department Of Social Service (DHHS)Worker
On 10/10/2024 I interviewed DHHS Worker by telephone. She
denied the allegations. She reported she communicates with
Foster Parent mostly via foster home visits. She said she obtains
information from Foster Parent on the children’s care and gets
updates about school or other matters. She gives Foster Parent
updates on how the children’s parenting time is going, and on
scheduling parenting times so that Foster Parent can plan her
day. She reported the birth mother has personally disclosed
information to Foster Parent, such as where she lives. That Foster
Parent has given the birth mother a ride home but that type of
information, nor other personal or confidential information about
the birth mother to Foster Parent has not come from her. She
4

said Foster Parent has shared information with her about the birth
mother that she did not know. Foster Parent told her birth mother
was getting kicked out of her housing, which Foster Parent
reported Person X told her.
DHHS Worker admitted there would have been a time it was
discussed that the birth mother was in the hospital, but that
information was reported at a court and during an FTM where both
the birth mother and Foster Parent were present for. DHHS
Worker also reported birth mother and Foster Parent get along,
communicate well when they see each other and they may have
shared information about themselves with the other.
Community Resource Coordinator (CRC)
On 10/10/2024 I interviewed CRC by telephone. She confirmed
information related to concerns being reported for Person X.
CRC reported it has been reported Person X can be very friendly
with clients, which can be good, but Person X has tended to be
overly friendly, and she may inadvertently or otherwise share too
much information. CRC reported she has spoken with Person X’s
agency about this matter. CRC also acknowledged there was
another issue whereby Person X was asked to be taken off a case
by an attorney, but CRC did not know the reason behind that.
CRC denied either Person X or Person X’s supervisor ever
reporting to her that DHHS Worker had shared confidential
information about a birth mother with a foster parent.
Reviewed
Child A and Child B’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
• They entered care on 2/24/2024 and are temporary court
wards.
• They were placed in Foster Parent’s foster home on
6/13/2024 and this is their third foster home placement.
• Social work contacts of case contacts and face-to face
contacts between DHHS Worker and Foster Parent from
6/13/2024- 9/13/2024 which did not show indication that
confidential information on the birth mother was shared by
DHHS Worker.
Analysis Based on interviews and documentation reviewed the evidence
does not support the allegations or a lack of responsible character
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
